snippet: As the rate of new infections has slowed, American and Liberian officials are debating whether to shift money that was planned for the centers into other programs to combat future outbreaks.
abstract: American and Liberian officials, noting slowed rate of Ebola infections in Liberia, are debating whether to build all 17 planned Ebola treatment centers there or to shift money from Obama administration into other programs to combat future outbreaks.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and SABRINA TAVERNISE

lead_paragraph: As the rate of new infections has slowed, American and Liberian officials are debating whether to shift money that was planned for the centers into other programs to combat future outbreaks.

headline.main: Health Officials Reassess Strategy to Combat Ebola in Liberia
headline.print_headline: Health Officials Reassess Strategy to Combat Ebola in Liberia

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
